alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Kern; Kings (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 2:40AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Western Fresno, Northwest Kern and Southwest Kings. * WHEN...Until 530 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Rockslides may cause blocked roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Avenal, Coalinga, Cantua Creek, Zapato Chino Creek, Castle Mountain and Spanish Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
